name: Payment for Successful Additional Weld Test
rule_text: Any welder who is required to do additional testing by the Employer, shall be paid for weld time of four (4) hours per successful test
summary: Welders receive 4 hours of pay for each successful additional weld test required by the employer.
logical_representation: IF test_type (llm) == 'ADDITIONAL' AND test_result (Unsupported) == 'SUCCESS' -> PAY(4_HOURS)
reasoning: This rule defines direct payment for time spent on a specific work-related activity (testing), which is a core component of worked time compensation.

name: Reduced Payment for Single Plate Weld Test
rule_text: (excluding the boiler ¼ Down Hand Plate or other single ¼ plate test, will be paid two (2) hours).
summary: As an exception to the standard 4-hour test pay, welders receive 2 hours of pay for a successful boiler ¼ Down Hand Plate or other single ¼ plate test.
logical_representation: IF test_type (llm) == 'BOILER_PLATE_SINGLE' AND test_result (Unsupported) == 'SUCCESS' -> PAY(2_HOURS)
reasoning: This rule modifies a payment amount for a specific type of work activity (testing), falling under worked time compensation.

name: Maximum Payment for Multi-Plate Weld Test
rule_text: Additional test consists of three plates welded in the vertical, horizontal and overhead positions and will be paid a maximum of four (4) hours total, upon successful completion.
summary: For a specific multi-plate test (vertical, horizontal, overhead), the total payment is capped at a maximum of 4 hours upon successful completion.
logical_representation: IF test_type (llm) == 'MULTI_PLATE' AND test_result (Unsupported) == 'SUCCESS' -> PAY(MAX(4_HOURS))
reasoning: This rule sets a maximum payment for a work activity, which is a form of worked time compensation.

name: Payment for Abbreviated Plate Test
rule_text: Those requested to take an abbreviated version of the plate test will be compensated at one and a half (1.5) hours for each successful plate test.
summary: Welders receive 1.5 hours of pay for each successful plate in an abbreviated version of the test.
logical_representation: IF test_type (llm) == 'ABBREVIATED_PLATE' AND test_result (Unsupported) == 'SUCCESS' -> PAY(1.5_HOURS_PER_PLATE)
reasoning: This rule establishes a specific pay rate for a defined work-related test, which falls under labor worked time.

name: No Payment for Failed Weld Test
rule_text: In any event a welder will not be paid for a failed test.
summary: Welders do not receive any payment for weld tests that they fail.
logical_representation: IF test_result (Unsupported) == 'FAIL' -> PAY(0)
reasoning: This rule explicitly denies payment for time spent on a work activity if a certain condition (failure) is met, defining a zero-pay outcome for worked time.

name: Travel Allowance for On-Site Weld Test
rule_text: If a welder is required to test at the job site, the welder shall be paid for any applicable travel allowance, but not for the failed test.
summary: If a welder must test at the job site, they are eligible for applicable travel allowances. This allowance is paid regardless of test outcome, but the time for a failed test itself is not paid.
logical_representation: IF test_location (llm) == 'ON_SITE' -> ALLOWANCE(TRAVEL)
reasoning: This rule provides an allowance specifically for travel, which falls under the category of subsistence and travel-related compensation.

name: Payment for Partially Successful Weld Tests
rule_text: If an Employer is requesting more than three (3) tests per welder and a welder has successfully completed three (3) of four (4) tests, the Employer may retain the welder and pay for the three (3) successful weld test. If the Employer decides not to retain the welder, he or she will be paid for the three (3) successful weld tests.
summary: When a welder takes four or more tests and passes at least three, they will be paid for the three successful tests, regardless of whether the employer decides to retain them.
logical_representation: IF number_of_tests (llm) >= 4 AND number_of_successful_tests (llm) == 3 -> PAY(FOR_THREE_SUCCESSFUL_TESTS)
reasoning: This is a rule about compensation for time spent on testing, contingent on performance, which is a facet of labor worked time.

name: Employer Responsibility for Weld Test Costs
rule_text: For every required test and any examiner permitted second test the Employer will pay the transfer fees, materials and inspector fees.
summary: The employer is responsible for paying all associated costs for required weld tests, including any permitted second attempts. This includes transfer fees, materials, and inspector fees.
logical_representation: IF test (Unsupported) == 'REQUIRED' OR test (Unsupported) == 'PERMITTED_SECOND_TEST' -> CONSTRAINT(EMPLOYER_PAYS_TEST_FEES)
reasoning: This rule defines an employer obligation directly related to a work activity (testing), ensuring the employee is not financially burdened, which is an entitlement related to the work itself.

name: Payment for Secondary Weld Tests
rule_text: Should a secondary test be required by the Employer, the employee shall be paid for the time required to take such a test.
summary: If an employer requires a welder to take a secondary test, the employee must be paid for the time it takes to complete that test.
logical_representation: IF test_type (llm) == 'SECONDARY' -> PAY(TIME_TAKEN)
reasoning: This rule mandates payment for time spent on a required work activity, which is a core concept of worked time.

name: Practice Material for Non-Standard Tests
rule_text: When a welder is required to perform a test of a type other than a standard Provincial test, the Employer shall, on request, make available suitable material to allow a brief period of practice prior to taking the actual test.
summary: For non-standard Provincial tests, the employer must provide suitable practice materials upon the welder's request before the actual test.
logical_representation: IF test_type (llm) == 'NON_STANDARD_PROVINCIAL' -> PROVIDE(PRACTICE_MATERIAL_ON_REQUEST)
reasoning: This rule provides a non-monetary entitlement directly related to performing a work activity (testing), ensuring fair conditions for completing the work.

name: Travel Reimbursement for Out-of-Town Weld Tests
rule_text: Any welder possessing a current Provincial Government welding certificate of qualification, who is instructed to proceed to take tests, necessitating their having to travel outside of the city limits of the city in which they reside or are employed, shall be reimbursed in an amount necessary to compensate them for travel allowance, transportation, travel expenses, subsistence allowance, if applicable.
summary: Welders with a current provincial certificate who must travel outside their home or employment city for a test will be reimbursed for travel allowance, transportation, travel expenses, and subsistence allowance as applicable.
logical_representation: IF has_provincial_certificate (llm) == true AND test_location (llm) == 'OUTSIDE_CITY_LIMITS' -> ALLOWANCE(TRAVEL) AND ALLOWANCE(TRANSPORTATION) AND ALLOWANCE(EXPENSES) AND ALLOWANCE(SUBSISTENCE)
reasoning: This rule explicitly deals with reimbursement for travel, expenses, and living allowances due to work-related travel, which is the definition of subsistence allowance.

name: Mutual Agreement on Out-of-Town Test Costs
rule_text: The Employer and the Local Lodge will communicate and mutually agree to related costs and test location(s) before proceeding with the testing.
summary: Before out-of-town testing proceeds, the Employer and the Local Lodge must communicate and mutually agree on the associated costs and test locations.
logical_representation: IF test_location (llm) == 'OUTSIDE_CITY_LIMITS' -> CONSTRAINT(MUTUAL_AGREEMENT_ON_COSTS_AND_LOCATION)
reasoning: This rule is a procedural constraint on the payment of travel and subsistence allowances, making it part of that topic.

name: Provision of Weld Test Papers
rule_text: Welders passing a test will be furnished a copy of the test papers from the Employer or party requiring the test within thirty (30) days, or upon completion of the job, whichever is sooner, provided they are available at that time; otherwise the Employer will provide a letter confirming the test and the results.
summary: Welders who pass a test must be given a copy of their test papers within 30 days or at job completion (whichever is sooner). If papers aren't available, a confirmation letter must be provided.
logical_representation: IF test_result (Unsupported) == 'SUCCESS' -> PROVIDE(TEST_PAPERS_OR_CONFIRMATION_LETTER)
reasoning: This is a non-monetary entitlement tied to the outcome of a work-related activity, ensuring proper documentation of work performed.

name: Fair Conditions for Provincial Certificate Tests
rule_text: Where a welder is to take an official Provincial test on which the issuance or re-issuance of their certificate will depend, they shall not be required to do so under conditions which would unfairly affect their ability to perform the test.
summary: Welders taking an official Provincial test for their certification must be provided fair testing conditions that do not negatively impact their performance.
logical_representation: IF test_type (llm) == 'OFFICIAL_PROVINCIAL' -> CONSTRAINT(FAIR_TESTING_CONDITIONS)
reasoning: This rule governs the conditions under which a work-related task (testing) is performed, which is an aspect of labor management and fair compensation for effort.

name: Test Conditions for Non-Provincial Tests
rule_text: For other tests, the Employer may prescribe test conditions approximating, but not exceeding, conditions which may be encountered on the job.
summary: For tests other than official Provincial ones, the employer can set test conditions that are similar to, but not more difficult than, actual on-the-job conditions.
logical_representation: IF test_type (llm) != 'OFFICIAL_PROVINCIAL' -> CONSTRAINT(TEST_CONDITIONS_NOT_EXCEEDING_JOB_CONDITIONS)
reasoning: Similar to the previous rule, this sets parameters for a work activity, ensuring the test is a fair measure of on-the-job capability.

name: Right to Complete Weld Test
rule_text: Welders required to take any test shall be allowed to complete the test.
summary: Any welder who is required to start a test must be allowed to finish it.
logical_representation: IF test (Unsupported) == 'REQUIRED' -> CONSTRAINT(MUST_BE_ALLOWED_TO_COMPLETE)
reasoning: This rule provides a right related to the performance of a work activity, ensuring the worker has a full opportunity to meet the requirements.

name: Forfeiture of Test Pay for Failure to Report to Work
rule_text: Any welder who successfully completes the welding test, but fails to report for work as notified, without a bona fide reason acceptable to the Employer, will not be eligible for any payment, including testing time and other allowances, as set out in Article 7.00.
summary: If a welder passes a test but then fails to show up for work without an acceptable reason, they forfeit all payments and allowances related to that test.
logical_representation: IF test_result (Unsupported) == 'SUCCESS' AND event (Unsupported) == 'FAILURE_TO_REPORT_FOR_WORK' -> FORFEIT(ALL_TEST_PAY_AND_ALLOWANCES)
reasoning: This rule links payment for a work activity (testing) to a subsequent work obligation (reporting to work), making it a conditional payment rule under worked time.

name: Second Test Opportunity for Pre-Job Weld Test
rule_text: Any welder required to take a pre-job welding test for employment with an Employer and fails the required weld test, the welder may be granted the opportunity to take a second test.
summary: A welder who fails a required pre-job welding test may be given a second chance to take the test.
logical_representation: IF test_type (llm) == 'PRE_JOB' AND test_result (Unsupported) == 'FAIL' -> CONDITION(MAY_BE_GRANTED_SECOND_TEST)
reasoning: This is a procedural rule about a work-related activity (pre-employment testing) and does not involve direct payment, but sets conditions for work engagement.

name: Overtime for Unilateral Shift Time Change
rule_text: If the foregoing starting or quitting times are changed without mutual agreement, applicable overtime rates shall be paid for any time worked before or after the above hours as a result of the change of times.
summary: If the employer changes the standard start or end times without mutual agreement, any time worked outside the originally defined hours must be paid at overtime rates.
logical_representation: IF mutual_agreement_on_change (llm) == false -> PAY(OT) FOR hours_worked OUTSIDE defined_shift_window
reasoning: This rule establishes a penalty that converts straight time to overtime under specific conditions, directly impacting labor cost calculation.

name: Penalty for Delayed Lunch Break
rule_text: If this break falls outside the regular lunch break established on the job, they shall receive an additional allowance of one-half (½) hour of pay at straight time rates which shall be in addition to their regular straight time hours.
summary: If an employee's rescheduled lunch break occurs outside the normal lunch period, they receive a penalty payment of 30 minutes at straight time.
logical_representation: IF worked_through_lunch_break (llm) == true AND rescheduled_break_timing (llm) OUTSIDE normal_lunch_period -> PAY(0.5_HOURS_ST)
reasoning: This rule dictates a specific monetary penalty for failing to provide a timely meal break, which directly adds to labor costs.

name: Maximum Gap Between Shifts
rule_text: Second (2 nd ) and third (3 rd ) shifts shall commence not later than one (1) hour after the completion of the preceding shift, except where this is prevented by conditions or requirements beyond the control of the Employer.
summary: The afternoon and night shifts must begin within one hour of the previous shift's completion, unless prevented by circumstances beyond the employer's control.
logical_representation: IF shift_name (llm) IN ['AFTERNOON', 'NIGHT'] -> CONSTRAINT(inter_shift_gap_hours (llm) <= 1)
reasoning: This rule sets a specific constraint on shift scheduling, which is a direct component of managing and defining LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Shift Premium for Afternoon and Night Shifts
rule_text:
A shift premium shall apply on all hours worked on second (2 nd ) and third (3 rd ) shifts at the rates as set out in the Wage and Benefit Schedule.

All shift premium hours will be paid at a rate of four dollars and fifty cents ($4.50) per hour.
summary: A shift premium of $4.50 per hour is paid for all hours worked on the second (afternoon) and third (night) shifts.
logical_representation: IF shift_name (llm) IN ['AFTERNOON', 'NIGHT'] -> PREMIUM($4.50)
reasoning: This rule establishes a pay premium based on the time of day worked (shift type), which is a core component of calculating pay for LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Minimum Rest Period Penalty
rule_text: When an employee is required to return to work without an eight (8) hour break, all work performed  shall  be  paid  for  at  the  applicable  overtime  rates,  until  such  time  as  the  employee receives an eight (8) hour break.
summary: If an employee works without getting an 8-hour break first, all hours worked are paid at overtime rates until an 8-hour break is given.
logical_representation: IF rest_period_hours (llm) < 8 -> APPLY_PAY_RULES('overtime') UNTIL rest_period_hours (llm) >= 8
reasoning: This rule establishes a condition (insufficient rest) that changes the pay rate for hours worked to overtime, which is a direct calculation rule for LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Voluntary Unscheduled Overtime
rule_text: Any unscheduled overtime will be voluntary and worked at the employees' discretion.
summary: Employees are not required to work overtime that has not been scheduled in advance; they may choose to work it or not.
logical_representation: IF overtime_type (llm) == 'UNSCHEDULED' -> CONDITION('Work is voluntary')
reasoning: This rule defines a condition related to performing overtime work, establishing it as voluntary. It relates to the conditions under which labor time is worked.

name: Meal Break Duration and Pay
rule_text: All overtime meal breaks will be thirty (30) minutes in duration and will be paid for at straight time rates.
summary: All overtime meal breaks are 30 minutes long and are paid at the employee's straight time rate.
logical_representation: CONDITION('Overtime meal breaks are 30 minutes') AND PAY(0.5, 'ST')
reasoning: This rule sets the duration and pay status of an overtime meal break, which directly relates to meal entitlements.

name: Meal Break Calculation Exclusion
rule_text: However, in calculating entitlement to a meal, the thirty (30) minute break shall not count as overtime work.
summary: The paid 30-minute meal break does not count as 'time worked' when determining eligibility for subsequent meal breaks.
logical_representation: CONDITION('Paid 30-minute meal break is excluded from daily_hours for calculating subsequent meal entitlements')
reasoning: This rule clarifies how meal break time is treated for calculation purposes, which is an integral part of meal allowance administration.

name: Scheduled Overtime Meal Allowance In Lieu
rule_text: Scheduled Overtime... I) a payment of thirty (30) minutes at the straight-time total package hourly rate in lieu of the meal break, and 2. II) a fifteen (15) minute rest break at the applicable rate of pay.
summary: If a meal is not provided during scheduled overtime when one is due, the employee receives 30 minutes of pay at their straight-time total package rate and a 15-minute paid rest break at the applicable rate.
logical_representation: IF overtime_type (llm) == 'SCHEDULED' AND meal_provided (llm) == false -> PAY(0.5, 'ST_TOTAL_PACKAGE') AND PAY(0.25, 'APPLICABLE_RATE')
reasoning: This rule specifies the monetary and time-off compensation provided when a meal entitlement is not fulfilled, which is a core function of meal allowance policies.

name: Unscheduled Overtime Meal Allowance In Lieu
rule_text: Unscheduled Overtime I) a payment of forty dollars ($40.00) as a meal allowance. 2. II) a payment of thirty (30) minutes at the straight-time total package hourly rate in the lieu of meal break, and 3. III) a fifteen (15) minute rest break at the applicable rate of pay.
summary: If a meal is not provided during unscheduled overtime when one is due, the employee receives a $40 meal allowance, 30 minutes of pay at their straight-time total package rate, and a 15-minute paid rest break at the applicable rate.
logical_representation: IF overtime_type (llm) == 'UNSCHEDULED' AND meal_provided (llm) == false -> ALLOWANCE(40.00) AND PAY(0.5, 'ST_TOTAL_PACKAGE') AND PAY(0.25, 'APPLICABLE_RATE')
reasoning: This rule details the specific monetary and time-off payments for a missed meal during unscheduled overtime, defining it as a meal allowance rule.

name: Meal Allowance for Employees on Subsistence
rule_text: There shall be no meal allowance applicable to those receiving subsistence, however any reduction to the current subsistence rates will attract a meal allowance payment equivalent to the reduction.
summary: Employees receiving a subsistence allowance are not eligible for an additional overtime meal allowance. However, if their subsistence pay is reduced, they will receive a meal allowance equal to the amount of the reduction.
logical_representation: IF is_receiving_subsistence (llm) == true -> FORFEIT(MEAL_ALLOWANCE) UNLESS subsistence_is_reduced (llm) == true
reasoning: This rule establishes an exclusion from meal allowances based on the receipt of subsistence pay, directly linking it to the meal allowance topic.

name: Meal Allowance for Employees in Camp
rule_text: Where a camp is provided, employees will not receive the forty dollars ($40.00) meal allowance where they are able to receive a camp meal at the end of their shift.
summary: Employees staying in a provided camp who can get a meal there after their shift are not eligible for the $40 meal allowance for unscheduled overtime.
logical_representation: IF is_in_camp (llm) == true AND camp_meal_available (llm) == true -> FORFEIT(ALLOWANCE(40.00))
reasoning: This rule specifies a condition (being in a camp) that negates eligibility for a specific meal allowance, making it a meal allowance rule.

name: Holiday Pay Allowance Calculation Basis
rule_text: This  pay  allowance  shall  be  applied  to  gross  wages  for  all  hours  earned  including: overtime and shift premium; and also to waiting and reporting time per Article 15.00; daily travel allowance per Article 16.01.
summary: The holiday pay allowance is calculated based on gross wages, which includes all earned hours like overtime, shift premiums, waiting/reporting time, and travel allowances.
logical_representation: CALCULATE(HOLIDAY_ALLOWANCE) BASED ON(gross_wages(including_overtime, shift_premium, waiting_time, reporting_time, travel_allowance))
reasoning: This is a calculation rule that specifies how holiday pay is determined, which falls under how labor time is compensated.

name: Waiting Time Pay, First Two Days
rule_text: When an employee, on initial hire or transfer to a project, is instructed by the Employer to report to a job location on a certain day but is not placed to work until a later date, they shall be  entitled  to  two  (2)  hours  pay, ... for  each  of  the  first  two  (2) regular working days they are kept waiting.
summary: A new or transferred employee who reports to a job but is not put to work is paid for 2 hours for each of the first two regular working days they are kept waiting.
logical_representation: IF (employee_status == 'NEW_HIRE' OR employee_status == 'TRANSFER') AND waiting_days <= 2 -> PAY(2_HOURS)
reasoning: This rule defines payment for non-worked time under specific conditions (waiting for work to start), which falls under the categorization and compensation of labor time.

name: Waiting Time Subsistence Entitlement
rule_text: ...plus  subsistence  if  applicable,  for  each  of  the  first  two  (2) regular working days they are kept waiting.
summary: An employee eligible for waiting time pay for the first two days is also entitled to receive subsistence if applicable.
logical_representation: IF (employee_status == 'NEW_HIRE' OR employee_status == 'TRANSFER') AND waiting_days <= 2 -> ALLOWANCE(SUBSISTENCE)
reasoning: This rule explicitly grants a subsistence allowance in conjunction with waiting time, making it a subsistence rule.

name: Waiting Time Pay, After Two Days
rule_text: Thereafter the waiting pay shall be increased to a full day of pay (i.e. eight (8) hours) for each regular working day.
summary: After waiting for two regular working days, the waiting time pay for a new or transferred employee increases to a full 8-hour day for each subsequent waiting day.
logical_representation: IF (employee_status == 'NEW_HIRE' OR employee_status == 'TRANSFER') AND waiting_days > 2 -> PAY(8_HOURS)
reasoning: This rule defines an increased payment rate for non-worked time after a specific waiting period, which is a core component of labor time compensation rules.

name: Waiting Time Pay Duration
rule_text: This waiting pay shall continue until the employee is given work or released from the job in which latter case Article 15.02 (c) shall govern.
summary: Waiting time pay continues until the employee either starts working or is released from the job.
logical_representation: IF employee_status == 'WAITING' -> CONTINUE_PAY UNTIL work_start_status == 'STARTED' OR employee_status == 'LAID_OFF'
reasoning: This rule sets the start and end conditions for a specific pay entitlement, directly relating to the calculation and duration of labor time compensation.

name: Reporting Time, Inclement Weather
rule_text: When an employee reports to work and cannot work because of inclement weather they shall be paid two (2) hours reporting time and the employee must remain on the job for the two (2) hour period, unless otherwise instructed by the Employer's supervisor.
summary: If an employee reports for work but cannot start due to bad weather, they receive 2 hours of pay and must stay on site for those 2 hours unless their supervisor releases them.
logical_representation: IF work_start_status == 'NOT_STARTED' AND cause_of_work_stoppage == 'INCLEMENT_WEATHER' -> PAY(2_HOURS) AND OBLIGATION(REMAIN_ON_SITE)
reasoning: This is a minimum pay guarantee for showing up to work, which is a core concept of labor time rules, defining compensation for non-worked but reported time.

name: Reporting Time, Work Not Available
rule_text: When an employee reports to work and is not given the opportunity to work because none is available or was not advised before the completion of the previous day of work, they shall be paid two (2) hours of reporting time and allowed to leave the job immediately.
summary: If an employee reports to work and finds no work is available, and they were not notified the day before, they receive 2 hours of pay and can leave immediately.
logical_representation: IF work_start_status == 'NOT_STARTED' AND cause_of_work_stoppage == 'WORK_NOT_AVAILABLE' AND prior_notification == false -> PAY(2_HOURS) AND RELEASED_FROM_SITE
reasoning: This rule provides a minimum payment for reporting to a shift that is subsequently canceled without notice, falling under worked time rules.

name: Employer Prerogative to Stop Work
rule_text: Subject to all of the above, it shall be the Employer's prerogative to decide whenever work shall be stopped during the day for any reason.
summary: The employer has the ultimate authority to decide when to stop work during the day for any reason, subject to the other rules in this article.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT(EMPLOYER_RIGHT_TO_STOP_WORK)
reasoning: While a management rights clause, it directly impacts work duration and pay entitlements, placing it within the scope of labor time.

name: Subsistence with Reporting or Waiting Time
rule_text: An employee who is affected by the Conditions set out above shall be entitled to subsistence in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement.
summary: Any employee who qualifies for waiting or reporting time pay is also entitled to receive subsistence pay as defined elsewhere in the agreement.
logical_representation: IF is_eligible_for_reporting_pay == true OR is_eligible_for_waiting_pay == true -> ALLOWANCE(SUBSISTENCE)
reasoning: The rule's primary function is to grant a subsistence allowance under specific conditions related to reporting or waiting time.

name: Reporting Time Forfeiture with Notification
rule_text: When an employee is notified eight (8) hours prior to the commencement of the scheduled starting time not to report for work, then such employee will not be entitled to any reporting time.
summary: An employee is not eligible for reporting time pay if they are notified not to come to work at least 8 hours before their shift starts.
logical_representation: IF notification_hours >= 8 -> FORFEIT(REPORTING_PAY)
reasoning: This rule defines a condition under which a pay entitlement (reporting time) is forfeited, which is a core labor time concept.

name: Reduced Notification for Camp Jobs
rule_text: On camp jobs, the notice time may be reduced to one (1) hour prior to starting time.
summary: For employees on camp jobs, the notification period to avoid paying reporting time is reduced from 8 hours to just 1 hour before the shift.
logical_representation: IF job_location_type == 'CAMP' AND notification_hours >= 1 -> FORFEIT(REPORTING_PAY)
reasoning: This rule modifies the condition for forfeiting a pay entitlement based on location, which is a labor time rule.

name: Layoff Option After Frequent Cancellations
rule_text: If this occurs more than twice in any one week, Monday through Friday, then the employee shall, at their option, be entitled to a layoff, however, this does not pertain to the normal Christmas break (i.e. two (2) weeks).
summary: If an employee is told not to report for work more than twice in a single Monday-to-Friday week, they have the option to accept a layoff. This does not apply during the Christmas break.
logical_representation: IF cancellation_frequency_per_week > 2 AND time_period != 'CHRISTMAS_BREAK' -> OPTION(EMPLOYEE_CHOICE_LAYOFF)
reasoning: This rule provides an employment status option based on the frequency of work cancellation, which is related to labor time and availability for work.

name: No Reporting Time During Strike
rule_text: When an employee is unable to report for work due to a strike or work stoppage on the project where they are employed, such employee will not be entitled to any reporting time.
summary: Employees are not entitled to reporting time pay if they cannot get to work because of a strike or work stoppage at their project.
logical_representation: IF cause_of_work_stoppage == 'STRIKE' OR cause_of_work_stoppage == 'WORK_STOPPAGE' -> FORFEIT(REPORTING_PAY)
reasoning: It specifies a condition for forfeiting reporting pay, a labor time entitlement.

name: Daily Allowances During Injury Care
rule_text: If an employee meets with an accident during working hours...they shall be paid those amounts as compensation as prescribed in the Workers' Compensation Act and shall also receive any other applicable daily allowances until such time that the employee is no longer in Employer's care.
summary: An employee injured on the job will continue to receive applicable daily allowances (like subsistence) as long as they are considered to be under the employer's care, in addition to WCB payments.
logical_representation: IF workplace_injury_status == 'UNDER_EMPLOYER_CARE' -> ALLOWANCE(DAILY_ALLOWANCES)
reasoning: The rule grants daily allowances, which often includes subsistence, under specific injury-related conditions. This aligns with allowances for remote or special work conditions.

name: Pay for Camp Room Move
rule_text: Should an employee residing in camp accommodation be requested by the Employer or the Clients' designated camp management personnel to move to another room or camp, they are to do it during work hours and will be paid at appropriate rates or the employee shall be paid two (2) hours at the applicable straight time rate to carry out the move, if done outside work hours.
summary: An employee in a camp who is required to move rooms must be paid for the time. If the move happens during work hours, it's paid time; if outside work hours, they receive 2 hours of straight-time pay.
logical_representation: IF activity_type == 'CAMP_ROOM_MOVE' AND timing_of_activity == 'DURING_WORK_HOURS' -> PAY(APPROPRIATE_RATE) ELSE IF activity_type == 'CAMP_ROOM_MOVE' AND timing_of_activity == 'OUTSIDE_WORK_HOURS' -> PAY(2_HOURS_ST)
reasoning: The rule defines payment for a specific, non-production activity, which falls under how time is compensated and is therefore a labor time rule.

name: Exception for Camp Room Move Pay
rule_text: This provision will not apply where employees are required to pack their room at the end of a work cycle or to facilitate a move that will occur during the employees furlough.
summary: Pay for moving rooms does not apply if the employee is packing up at the end of their work rotation or for a move that will happen while they are on their days off (furlough).
logical_representation: IF activity_type == 'CAMP_ROOM_MOVE' AND (reason_for_move == 'END_OF_CYCLE' OR reason_for_move == 'DURING_FURLOUGH') -> FORFEIT(MOVE_PAY)
reasoning: This defines an exception to a pay rule for a specific activity, making it a labor time rule.

name: Transportation for Camp Move
rule_text: Transportation will be supplied if required.
summary: If an employee is required to move rooms in camp, transportation will be provided if necessary.
logical_representation: IF activity_type == 'CAMP_ROOM_MOVE' -> PROVIDE(TRANSPORTATION)
reasoning: While not a direct monetary allowance, providing transportation is a non-monetary benefit related to the logistics of working away from home, which aligns most closely with the concept of subsistence and travel allowances.

name: Employer Provided Transport (45-120km)
rule_text: On those projects that are located between forty-five (45) radius kilometers to one hundred and twenty (120) radius kilometers from Edmonton and/or Calgary City Hall(s) or other Hiring Hall locations, the Employer shall supply suitable transportation to and from the project and mutually agreed to pick-up points.
summary: For projects located between 45 and 120 radius kilometers from a designated city hall or hiring hall, the employer is required to provide transportation for employees to and from agreed-upon pickup points.
logical_representation: IF (project_distance_from_city_hall_km >= 45 AND project_distance_from_city_hall_km <= 120) OR (project_distance_from_hiring_hall >= 45 AND project_distance_from_hiring_hall <= 120) -> PROVIDE(TRANSPORTATION)
reasoning: The rule describes a travel-related benefit (transportation) which falls under the broader category of subsistence and remote work allowances.

name: Daily Travel Allowance Alternative (45-120km)
rule_text: Alternatively, the Employer shall pay to each employee a transportation cost at the rate of sixty-nine cents ($0.69) per road kilometer for each day worked or reported for work, from the edge of the forty-five (45) radius kilometer free zone to the project and return.
summary: As an alternative to providing transportation for projects 45-120km away, the employer can pay a travel allowance of $0.69 per kilometer for the distance traveled from the 45km free zone to the project and back. This is paid for each day worked or reported.
logical_representation: IF (project_distance_from_city_hall_km >= 45 AND project_distance_from_city_hall_km <= 120) AND work_status IN ['WORKED', 'REPORTED'] -> PAY(0.69 * travel_distance_from_free_zone_km * 2)
reasoning: This rule details a monetary allowance for daily travel, which is a core component of subsistence policies.

name: Review of Daily Travel Cost
rule_text: The transportation cost will be reviewed by the Boilermaker/BCA Liaison Committee should there be general increases or reductions in the reference agreements.
summary: The daily travel allowance rate will be reviewed by a joint committee if there are changes in the reference agreements.
logical_representation: IF reference_agreement_change == true -> TRIGGER_REVIEW(transportation_cost)
reasoning: This rule governs the process for updating travel allowances, which is an administrative aspect of subsistence policies.

name: Subsistence Eligibility (>120km)
rule_text: Subsistence will be paid or camp provided on projects which are more than one hundred and twenty (120) radius kilometers from the City Hall(s) of Edmonton and Calgary or other Hiring Hall locations.
summary: On projects located more than 120 radius kilometers from a designated city hall or hiring hall, the employer must either pay a subsistence allowance or provide camp accommodation.
logical_representation: IF project_distance_from_city_hall_km > 120 OR project_distance_from_hiring_hall > 120 -> ALLOWANCE(SUBSISTENCE) OR PROVIDE(CAMP)
reasoning: This rule establishes the primary condition for an employee's eligibility for subsistence or camp accommodation, a key aspect of subsistence allowances.

name: Standard Daily Subsistence Rate
rule_text: Subsistence will be paid at a rate of one hundred and fifty dollars ($150.00) per day worked or reported for.
summary: The standard subsistence rate is $150.00 per day worked or reported for, unless a specific location rate applies.
logical_representation: IF work_status IN ['WORKED', 'REPORTED'] -> ALLOWANCE(150.00)
reasoning: The rule specifies the default monetary amount for the daily subsistence allowance.
