logical_representation: IF activity_type (Unsupported) == 'CLIENT_ONBOARDING_TRAINING' -> PAY(prescribed_time_hours * straight_time_total_package_rate)
reasoning: This rule dictates payment for time spent on a required activity, which falls under the category of worked time compensation.

name: Client Onboarding Pay on Job Cancellation
rule_text: When a job call is cancelled, and employees at the direction of the Employer have completed the required course(s), this Article shall apply and those affected shall be compensated.
summary: If a job is cancelled after an employee has completed the required client training at the employer's direction, they will still be paid for that training time.
logical_representation: IF activity_type (Unsupported) == 'CLIENT_ONBOARDING_TRAINING' AND job_status (llm) == 'CANCELLED' -> PAY(prescribed_time_hours * straight_time_total_package_rate)
reasoning: This is an entitlement for compensation for a work-related activity (training) under a specific condition (job cancellation), making it a worked time rule.

name: Forfeiture of Client Onboarding Pay
rule_text: Alternatively, compensation will not be provided to employees who complete the required course(s) but fail to report for duty.
summary: Employees who complete the required client training but then do not show up for work will not be paid for the training time.
logical_representation: IF activity_type (Unsupported) == 'CLIENT_ONBOARDING_TRAINING' AND employee_action (llm) == 'FAIL_TO_REPORT' -> FORFEIT(PAY)
reasoning: This rule specifies a condition under which a worked time payment is forfeited, directly relating it to labor compensation.

name: Camp Move Payment on Transfer
rule_text: Transfer from one site to another will not trigger additional initial and terminal travel payments, however, should an employee be required to move from one camp to another, they will be entitled to a payment of two (2) hours at the straight time rate should this occur outside of regular scheduled work hours
summary: If an employee is required to move from one camp to another outside of their regular work hours as part of a transfer, they will be paid for two hours at the straight-time rate.
logical_representation: IF activity_type (Unsupported) == 'CAMP_MOVE' AND activity_timing (llm) == 'OUTSIDE_REGULAR_HOURS' -> PAY(2 * straight_time_rate)
reasoning: This rule specifies a payment for a work-directed activity that occurs outside of normal work hours, which is a form of worked time compensation.

name: Reporting Pay for Cancelled Dispatch (Non-Local)
rule_text: When personnel requests are cancelled by the Employer after employees have been dispatched by their respective Union, the Union and the Employer agree to make every attempt to contact the affected employees. Employees who cannot be contacted will receive eight (8) hours pay at the straight time total package hourly rate for reporting for work, and must be, at the Company's discretion, prepared to remain on the job. This provision does not apply to local hires.
summary: If a non-local employee is dispatched to a job that is then cancelled, and they cannot be contacted beforehand, they will receive 8 hours of show-up pay at their straight-time total package rate upon reporting to the job site. They may be required to remain on the job if requested.
logical_representation: IF job_status (llm) == 'CANCELLED_AFTER_DISPATCH' AND employee_action (llm) == 'REPORTS_TO_WORK' AND is_local_resident (Unsupported) == false -> PAY(8 * straight_time_total_package_rate)
reasoning: The rule provides a minimum pay guarantee (reporting pay) when an employee reports for work under specific circumstances, which is a core concept of worked time compensation.

name: Pay for Moving Room or Camp
rule_text: Should an employee residing in camp accommodation be requested by the Employer or the Clients' designated camp management personnel to move to another room or camp, they are to do it during work hours and will be paid at appropriate rates or the employee shall be paid two (2) hours at the applicable straight time rate to carry out the move, if done outside work hours.
summary: If an employee in camp accommodation is required to move to another room or camp, the move should be done during paid work hours. If the move is performed outside of work hours, the employee will be paid 2 hours at their straight-time rate.
logical_representation: IF activity_type (Unsupported) == 'ROOM_OR_CAMP_MOVE' AND activity_timing (llm) == 'OUTSIDE_WORK_HOURS' -> PAY(2 * straight_time_rate)
reasoning: This rule defines compensation for a required activity performed outside of regular work hours, classifying it as a worked time entitlement.

name: Earned Days Off (EDO) Entitlement
rule_text: this work schedule is utilized to compensate the Employees for hours lost during the twenty-six (26) yearly earned days off (EDO's)... Of the twenty-six (26) EDO's, eighteen (18) will be scheduled by Suncor and the remaining eight (8) will be designated as flex EDO's to be taken as mutually agreed between the employee and the supervisor.
summary: Long Term Base Crew Employees are entitled to twenty-six Earned Days Off (EDOs) per year. Eighteen of these are scheduled by Suncor, and the remaining eight are flexible EDOs scheduled by mutual agreement.
logical_representation: IF employee_category (llm) == 'LONG_TERM_BASE_CREW' -> ENTITLEMENT(26_EDO_PER_YEAR) WHERE edo_type (llm) == 'SCHEDULED' -> 18 AND edo_type (llm) == 'FLEX' -> 8
reasoning: This rule details an entitlement for paid days off, which are a form of compensation for worked time. It directly relates to how an employee's overall work schedule and compensation are structured.

name: Definition of Long Term Base Crew Employee
rule_text: It is understood that when an employee is hired with the intentions of an employment term of more than a six (6) week period, that employee will be automatically on the aforementioned Compressed Work Week arrangements and be considered as a Long Term Base Crew Employee.
summary: An employee hired with the intent to work for more than six weeks is automatically classified as a Long Term Base Crew Employee and placed on the Compressed Work Week schedule.
logical_representation: IF intended_employee_tenure_weeks (llm) > 6 -> SET(employee_category (llm), 'LONG_TERM_BASE_CREW') AND APPLY_PAY_RULES('5x9')
reasoning: This rule defines the criteria for an employee classification that determines their pay schedule and rules. This classification is fundamental to applying the correct worked time calculations.

name: Transition from Short Term to Long Term Crew
rule_text: Should the employee be employed onsite after six (6) weeks on the job, that employee will then be considered part of the Long Term Crew and paid in accordance with the Compressed Work Week payment terms (except as outlined in item (e) below).
summary: If a short-term employee remains on site for more than six weeks, they will be reclassified as part of the Long Term Crew and paid according to the Compressed Work Week rules.
logical_representation: IF employee_tenure_weeks (llm) > 6 -> SET(employee_category (llm), 'LONG_TERM_BASE_CREW') AND APPLY_PAY_RULES('5x9')
reasoning: This rule dictates a change in an employee's pay structure based on their length of service. This directly impacts how their work hours are calculated and paid, placing it in the labor worked time topic.

name: Overtime on Scheduled Earned Days Off
rule_text: Overtime  payments  for  work  on  the  scheduled  eighteen  (18)  days  off  will  be  at doubletime (2x).
summary: Work performed on one of the eighteen company-scheduled Earned Days Off will be paid at double time (2x) the regular rate.
logical_representation: IF work_on_edo (llm) == true AND edo_type (llm) == 'SCHEDULED' -> PREMIUM(2.0)
reasoning: This rule sets a specific overtime premium for working on a designated day off, which is a fundamental aspect of labor worked time calculation.

name: Overtime on Flex EDO without Sufficient Notice
rule_text: If an employee is asked to work their scheduled flex day off without being given forty-eight (48) hours notice, then the employee will be paid overtime at doubletime (2x).
summary: If an employee is required to work on their scheduled flexible Earned Day Off without at least 48 hours' notice, the work will be paid at double time (2x).
logical_representation: IF work_on_edo (llm) == true AND edo_type (llm) == 'FLEX' AND notice_period_hours (llm) < 48 -> PREMIUM(2.0)
reasoning: This rule defines an overtime premium based on working on a day off and a notice condition, which falls squarely within the scope of labor worked time rules.

name: Notice Period for Flex EDO Requests
rule_text: The employee will provide a minimum of seven (7) days notice when requesting flex. EDO's.
summary: Employees must give at least seven days' notice when requesting to use a flexible Earned Day Off.
logical_representation: IF request_edo (llm) == true AND edo_type (llm) == 'FLEX' -> REQUIREMENT(notice_period_days (llm) >= 7)
reasoning: This rule sets a procedural condition for taking an earned day off, which is a component of the overall management of an employee's work schedule and time off entitlements.

name: No Overtime for Untaken Flex EDOs
rule_text: overtime payment will not be made for flex days not taken by the employee with the exception of those circumstances outlined in items b) and c) above
summary: Employees will not receive overtime pay for unused flexible EDOs, except under the specific circumstances related to short-term employment or termination adjustments.
logical_representation: IF edo_type (llm) == 'FLEX' AND edo_is_untaken (llm) == true -> FORFEIT(overtime_payment) UNLESS (condition_b_applies OR condition_c_applies)
reasoning: This rule clarifies that an entitlement (flex EDO) does not convert to overtime pay if unused, which is a rule governing compensation for time and falls under labor worked time.

name: Plant Shutdown Pay Continuation for Short Term Employees
rule_text: Those hired for the Plant Shutdown will continue to receive compensation under the terms of short term employment until the conclusion of the work even if they are on site longer than  six  (6)  weeks.
summary: Employees hired for a Plant Shutdown will remain on short-term employment pay terms for the entire duration of the shutdown, even if it exceeds six weeks.
logical_representation: IF event (Unsupported) == 'PLANT_SHUTDOWN' AND hired_for_shutdown (llm) == true -> MAINTAIN(employee_category (llm), 'SHORT_TERM') REGARDLESS of employee_tenure_weeks (llm)
reasoning: This rule acts as an override to the standard tenure-based reclassification rule, ensuring a specific pay structure remains in place for the duration of an event. This directly governs how worked time is compensated.

name: Approved Work Week Alterations Applicability - Shell Scotford
rule_text: SHELL SCOTFORD, FT. SASKATCHEWAN, ALBERTA
summary: This rule specifies that approved work week alterations are applicable for projects at the Shell Scotford site in Fort Saskatchewan, Alberta.
logical_representation: IF project_location (Unsupported) == 'SHELL_SCOTFORD_FT_SASKATCHEWAN' -> APPLY_RULES('APPROVED_WORK_WEEK_ALTERATIONS')
reasoning: This rule defines the geographic location where specific work schedule rules apply. The scheduling of work hours is a core component of LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Approved Work Week Alterations Applicability - IOL Strathcona
rule_text: IOL STRATHCONA
summary: This rule specifies that approved work week alterations are applicable for projects at the IOL Strathcona site.
logical_representation: IF project_location (Unsupported) == 'IOL_STRATHCONA' -> APPLY_RULES('APPROVED_WORK_WEEK_ALTERATIONS')
reasoning: This rule defines the geographic location where specific work schedule rules apply. The scheduling of work hours is a core component of LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Scheduled EDO Overtime Pay
rule_text: Overtime payments for work on the sixteen (16) scheduled EDO's will be paid at double-time (2x).
summary: All hours worked on any of the sixteen scheduled Earned Days Off (EDOs) are paid at double time (2x).
logical_representation: IF is_scheduled_edo (llm) == true -> TRANSITION(DT)
reasoning: This rule dictates the pay rate for a special type of scheduled day (EDO), which is a key component of classifying and paying for worked time.

name: Subsistence Assistance - Lodging Guarantee
rule_text: The employer, where requested by both the employee and the Business Manager of the applicable Local Union, would either: (i) guarantee or pay for the room with the lodging in place at an amount not to exceed the daily subsistence rate, until the employee receives their first pay cheque or completes the assignment, whichever occurs first.
summary: Upon a joint request from an employee and their Union Business Manager, the employer can either guarantee or directly pay for the employee's lodging. This financial assistance is capped at the daily subsistence rate and lasts only until the employee receives their first paycheck or the job ends, whichever happens first.
logical_representation: IF is_subsistence_job (llm) == true AND request_source (llm) == 'EMPLOYEE_AND_UNION' -> PROVIDE(LODGING_GUARANTEE_OR_PAYMENT, MAX_AMOUNT(subsistence_rate (llm)), DURATION(assistance_duration (llm)))
reasoning: This rule outlines a specific form of financial assistance (guaranteeing lodging) for employees on subsistence jobs, which is a core component of subsistence allowance policies.

name: Subsistence Assistance - Cash Advance
rule_text: provide the employee with "an advance", based on the subsistence allowance for the time period stated in (i), which will be deducted from the first pay cheque.
summary: As an alternative to paying for lodging directly, the employer can provide a cash advance to the employee. The advance amount is based on the subsistence allowance and covers the period until the first paycheck or the end of the assignment. This advance is then deducted from the employee's first paycheck.
logical_representation: IF is_subsistence_job (llm) == true AND request_source (llm) == 'EMPLOYEE_AND_UNION' -> PROVIDE(SUBSISTENCE_ADVANCE, DURATION(assistance_duration (llm))) | CONSTRAINT(DEDUCT_FROM_FIRST_PAYCHEQUE)
reasoning: This rule details a monetary advance for living expenses on a remote job, which is a direct form of subsistence allowance.

name: Subsistence Advance Request Procedure
rule_text: All requests for subsistence advances shall be confirmed in writing by the Local Union Business Manager or their designee at the time of referral. It is acknowledged that the Business Manager will only make this request where they are aware of a legitimate need for such advances.
summary: Any request for a subsistence advance must be formally confirmed in writing by the Union Business Manager or their representative. This request should only be made if the Business Manager believes there is a legitimate need for the financial assistance.
logical_representation: IF request_type (llm) == 'SUBSISTENCE_ADVANCE' -> CONSTRAINT(request_confirmation_method (llm) == 'WRITTEN_BY_UNION_BUSINESS_MANAGER')
reasoning: This rule establishes a mandatory procedure for claiming a subsistence benefit, making it an administrative component of the LABOR_SUBSISTENCE_ALLOWANCE topic.

name: Subsistence Assistance Ineligibility with Camp
rule_text: This arrangement does not apply where a camp is available.
summary: The subsistence assistance options, such as lodging guarantees or cash advances, are not available to employees if a work camp is provided.
logical_representation: IF is_camp_available (llm) == true -> FORFEIT(SUBSISTENCE_ASSISTANCE)
reasoning: This rule defines a key condition that negates eligibility for subsistence assistance, placing it squarely within the LABOR_SUBSISTENCE_ALLOWANCE topic.

name: Subsistence Assistance Request Not Subject to Grievance
rule_text: It is understood that a request herein shall not be subject to either grievance or arbitration.
summary: Requests made for subsistence assistance under this policy cannot be challenged through the formal grievance or arbitration processes.
logical_representation: IF request_type (llm) == 'SUBSISTENCE_ASSISTANCE' -> CONSTRAINT(NOT_SUBJECT_TO_GRIEVANCE_OR_ARBITRATION)
reasoning: This rule governs the dispute resolution process (or lack thereof) for a subsistence benefit, which is directly related to the administration of the LABOR_SUBSISTENCE_ALLOWANCE.

name: Maintenance Base Rate, Fort McMurray
rule_text: I) Fort McMurray only: Maintenance Base Rates will be set at 100% of Construction Base Rates plus 100% of appropriate benefits.
summary: In Fort McMurray, the maintenance base wage rate is equal to 100% of the construction base rate, plus all applicable benefits.
logical_representation: IF project_location (Unsupported) == 'Fort McMurray' -> PAY(maintenance_base_rate = construction_base_rate * 1.0) AND PROVIDE(benefits * 1.0)
reasoning: This rule directly defines the formula for calculating base wage rates based on location, a core component of labor time and cost.

name: Maintenance Base Rate, Outside Fort McMurray
rule_text: II) Outside of Fort McMurray: Long & Short Term Maintenance Base Rates will be set at $0.75 under Construction Base Rates plus 100% of appropriate benefits.
summary: Outside of Fort McMurray, the maintenance base wage rate is set at the construction base rate minus $0.75, plus all applicable benefits.
logical_representation: IF project_location (Unsupported) != 'Fort McMurray' -> PAY(maintenance_base_rate = construction_base_rate - 0.75) AND PROVIDE(benefits * 1.0)
reasoning: This rule provides an alternative formula for calculating base wage rates based on location, which is a key aspect of labor cost.

name: Skill Premium Payments
rule_text: Appropriate skill premiums to be paid in accordance with past maintenance jobsite practice.
summary: Skill premiums will be paid based on the established practices of past maintenance jobsites.
logical_representation: PAY(skill_premium (llm)) -> BASED_ON(past_practice (llm))
reasoning: This rule dictates the payment of premiums on top of base wages, which is a part of calculating the total cost of worked time.

name: Benefit Code C Calculation
rule_text: C Calculated on total hours paid.
summary: Benefits designated under Code C are calculated based on the total hours an employee is paid for, which may include hours not worked (e.g., show-up time).
logical_representation: IF benefit_code (llm) == 'C' -> CALCULATE_BENEFIT_ON(total_hours_paid (llm))
reasoning: This rule defines the calculation basis for a specific benefit code, linked to paid hours, which is a fundamental aspect of labor cost.

name: Benefit Code D Calculation
rule_text: D Calculated on total wages.
summary: Benefits designated under Code D are calculated as a percentage or function of an employee's total wages.
logical_representation: IF benefit_code (llm) == 'D' -> CALCULATE_BENEFIT_ON(total_wages (llm))
reasoning: This rule establishes the calculation basis for a benefit code based on total earnings, directly relating to the overall labor cost.

name: Employer Payroll Responsibility
rule_text: EMPLOYERS ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR OPERATING THEIR OWN PAYROLL IN AN ACCURATE AND TIMELY FASHION PURSUANT TO THE COLLECTIVE AGREEMENT WAGE AND BENEFIT FORMULA.
summary: Employers are required to manage their payroll accurately and on time, following the wage and benefit rules outlined in the collective agreement.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT(employer_must_operate_payroll_accurately_and_timely)
reasoning: This rule establishes an employer's obligation regarding the administration of wages and benefits, which falls under the umbrella of managing labor costs and worked time.

name: Union Dues Deduction
rule_text: APPROPRIATE UNION DUES DEDUCTIONS ARE TO BE MADE PURSUANT TO THE LOCAL AGREEMENTS.
summary: Employers must deduct the correct amount of union dues from employee pay, as specified by the relevant local agreements.
logical_representation: ACTION(deduct_union_dues) -> BASED_ON(local_agreements)
reasoning: This rule concerns a mandatory payroll deduction tied to employment and wages, making it relevant to the overall calculation of net pay and labor costs.

name: Employer Contribution Remittance
rule_text: Employers are responsible for ensuring all employer contributions required for maintenance activities under this agreement are forwarded to the appropriate organization.
summary: Employers have the responsibility to make sure that all required contributions for maintenance work are sent to the correct organizations.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT(employer_must_remit_contributions_to_correct_organization)
reasoning: This is an administrative rule governing the payment of labor-related benefits and contributions, falling under the management of labor costs.

name: Basis for Appropriate Benefits
rule_text: The Parties agree that the application of the 100% of Appropriate Benefits will be based upon the respective Local Union's Construction Reference Agreement.
summary: The term '100% of Appropriate Benefits' means that the benefits provided will be determined by the rules set in the Construction Reference Agreement of the relevant Local Union.
logical_representation: SET_BASIS(appropriate_benefits) -> BASED_ON(local_union_construction_reference_agreement)
reasoning: This rule defines the source document for determining benefits, which is a critical part of calculating the total cost of labor.

name: Benefit Contribution Calculation Method
rule_text: Benefit contributions based on hours earned in construction will be paid on hours earned in maintenance and contributions based on hours worked in construction will be paid on hours worked in maintenance.
summary: The method for calculating benefit contributions in maintenance mirrors the construction agreement: if a benefit is based on 'hours earned' in construction, it's paid on 'hours earned' in maintenance. If it's based on 'hours worked' in construction, it's paid on 'hours worked' in maintenance.
logical_representation: IF construction_benefit_basis == 'hours_earned' -> SET_BASIS(maintenance_benefit, 'hours_earned') AND IF construction_benefit_basis == 'hours_worked' -> SET_BASIS(maintenance_benefit, 'hours_worked')
reasoning: This rule specifies the precise logic for how benefit contributions are calculated, tying them directly to hours, which is the core of the LABOR_WORKED_TIME topic.

name: Work End Time on Election Day
rule_text: All work scheduled on a Provincial, Federal or Municipal, Election Day will end at 16:00 hrs;
summary: Work must stop at 4:00 PM on any provincial, federal, or municipal election day.
logical_representation: IF is_election_day (llm) == true -> CONSTRAINT(work_ends_at_16:00)
reasoning: This rule sets a maximum working time on a specific type of day, which directly relates to the management and categorization of worked hours.

name: Overtime Applicability
rule_text: Overtime - applies to all positions including non-manuals, as per overtime definitions in NMA or BM Agreement
summary: Overtime pay is applicable to all positions, including non-manual roles. The specific definitions and calculations for what constitutes overtime are determined by either the NMA or the Boilermaker (BM) Agreement.
logical_representation: FOR ALL position_classification -> APPLY_PAY_RULES('NMA_OT') OR APPLY_PAY_RULES('BM_AGREEMENT_OT')
reasoning: This rule establishes that overtime pay applies to all workers and directs how it is to be calculated, which is fundamental to categorizing worked time.

name: Double Time Applicability
rule_text: Double Time - applies to all union positions including non-manuals as per NMA or BM Agreement
summary: Double time pay applies to all union positions, including non-manual roles. The specific conditions that trigger double time pay are defined in the NMA or the Boilermaker (BM) Agreement.
logical_representation: IF is_union_position (llm) == true -> APPLY_PAY_RULES('NMA_DT') OR APPLY_PAY_RULES('BM_AGREEMENT_DT')
reasoning: This rule establishes the applicability of double time pay, which is a category of worked time.

name: Billable Orientation and On-boarding Hours
rule_text: Orientation / on-boarding hours are all billable (facilities to be provided by NWR)
summary: All time spent by personnel in orientation or on-boarding activities is considered billable time and will be charged to the owner.
logical_representation: IF activity_type (Unsupported) == 'ONBOARDING' -> PAY(WORKED_HOURS)
reasoning: This rule defines a specific non-production activity (orientation/on-boarding) as billable worked time, directly impacting labor payment.

name: Non-Billable Time for Untrained Arrivals
rule_text: No hours may be charged to Owner for Supplier Group members that arrive at Site without the required training.
summary: Time is not billable for any worker who arrives at the site without having completed all required pre-mobilization training.
logical_representation: IF has_required_training (llm) == false -> FORFEIT(PAY)
reasoning: This rule defines a condition under which time is not billable, directly impacting payment for labor.

name: Billable Site-Specific Training
rule_text: Notwithstanding the foregoing in this Subsection, any Site specific training will be to Owner's account.
summary: All time that personnel spend in site-specific training, which is provided by the owner, is billable.
logical_representation: IF activity_type (Unsupported) == 'TRAINING' AND training_type (llm) == 'SITE_SPECIFIC' -> PAY(WORKED_HOURS)
reasoning: This rule classifies a specific type of training as billable worked time, affecting labor payment.

name: Pay Continuity During Transfer
rule_text: Where transfers are permitted above, such transfers shall be working within the jurisdiction of the Union and there shall be no interruption of the Employees' earnings while being transferred.
summary: An employee's earnings must not be interrupted when they are transferred between job sites within the Union's jurisdiction.
logical_representation: IF employee_status == 'TRANSFER' -> PROVIDE(EARNINGS_CONTINUITY)
reasoning: This rule mandates continuous payment during a specific work event (transfer), which is a rule about how work time is compensated. It's a guarantee of payment, fitting within LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Exception to Pay Continuity for Transfers During Leave
rule_text: This clause does not apply to Employees who are on regularly scheduled holidays or absent from work for compassionate reasons, and who are to report to a different job site upon their return.
summary: The rule for uninterrupted earnings during a transfer does not apply if the employee is on a scheduled holiday or compassionate leave and is scheduled to report to a new site upon their return.
logical_representation: IF employee_status == 'TRANSFER' AND (is_on_holiday == true OR is_on_compassionate_leave == true) -> FORFEIT(EARNINGS_CONTINUITY)
reasoning: This is a direct exception to a pay rule, defining a condition where a pay guarantee does not apply. It is therefore classified under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Online Orientation Pay
rule_text: If  an  Employer  requires  an  employee  to  complete  an  employer  online  orientation,  the Employer shall estimate a reasonable amount of time to complete the orientation.  The Employer shall pay an allowance for completing the course equal to the time estimated, to a maximum of four (4) hours, multiplied by the employee's base rate only and payable with the first pay period following the start of work.
summary: Employees must be paid for completing a mandatory online orientation. The pay is based on the employer's estimated time to complete it, up to a maximum of 4 hours, at the employee's base rate, and is paid with the first paycheque.
logical_representation: IF activity_type == 'ONLINE_ORIENTATION' -> PAY(MIN(estimated_time_for_orientation, 4) * base_rate)
reasoning: This rule dictates payment for a work-related activity (orientation). It defines how time spent on this activity is compensated, fitting within the LABOR_WORKED_TIME category.

name: No Benefits on Online Orientation Pay
rule_text: Payment for online orientation will not attract VSP or any benefit contributions.
summary: The payment for completing online orientation is not subject to VSP or other benefit contributions.
logical_representation: IF activity_type == 'ONLINE_ORIENTATION' -> NO_BENEFIT_CONTRIBUTIONS
reasoning: This rule specifies the benefit treatment of a particular type of payment, which is an integral part of how labor compensation is calculated. It is an attribute of the orientation pay rule and thus falls under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Reporting Pay When Not Engaged
rule_text: Members of the Union dispatched from the Union office reporting for work at the time and place specified by the Employer and who are not engaged by the Employer shall receive a minimum of two (2) hours locally or four (4) hours beyond 300 km reporting pay, plus travel allowance and expense, if applicable.
summary: A dispatched union member who reports for work but is not hired receives 2 hours of reporting pay, or 4 hours if the job is over 300 km away. They may also receive travel allowance and expenses if applicable.
logical_representation: IF work_start_status == 'NOT_ENGAGED' -> PAY(MIN(IF job_distance_km > 300 THEN 4 ELSE 2)_hours) AND ALLOWANCE(TRAVEL) AND ALLOWANCE(EXPENSE)
reasoning: This rule provides a minimum pay guarantee for employees who report to work as instructed but are not put to work. This 'show-up time' or 'reporting pay' is a classic component of LABOR_WORKED_TIME rules.

name: Exception to Reporting Pay with Prior Notice
rule_text: This Clause does not apply where the Employer has notified the Union(s) in a reasonable time that the Employee is not eligible for hire.
summary: Reporting pay is not required if the employer notifies the union with reasonable advance notice that the dispatched employee is not eligible for hire.
logical_representation: IF work_start_status == 'NOT_ENGAGED' AND employer_gave_reasonable_notice == true -> FORFEIT(REPORTING_PAY)
reasoning: This rule outlines a specific condition under which the reporting pay guarantee is forfeited. As a direct modifier of a pay guarantee rule, it falls under the LABOR_WORKED_TIME topic.

name: Industrial Work Contributions - H&W and ISIT
rule_text: Calculate the Health and Welfare and "ISIT" contribution on hours earned
summary: For employees performing Industrial Work under Local 488, the Health & Welfare (H&W) and ISIT contributions are calculated based on the total hours earned.
logical_representation: IF work_category (llm) == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND union_local (Unsupported) == '488' AND benefit_type (llm) IN ['H&W', 'ISIT'] -> SET_CALCULATION_BASIS('HOURS_EARNED')
reasoning: This rule defines the calculation basis (hours earned) for specific benefit contributions, which is a core component of labor cost and time tracking.

name: Industrial Work Contributions - Pension, Training, SBTF
rule_text: Pension (Earned), Training (Earned), SBTF (Earned)
summary: For employees performing Industrial Work under Local 488, contributions for Pension, Training, and the Supplementary Benefit Trust Fund (SBTF) are calculated based on total hours earned.
logical_representation: IF work_category (llm) == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND union_local (Unsupported) == '488' AND benefit_type (llm) IN ['PENSION', 'TRAINING', 'SBTF'] -> SET_CALCULATION_BASIS('HOURS_EARNED')
reasoning: This rule defines the calculation basis for several benefit contributions, directly impacting how worked time translates into labor cost.

name: UAW&O Contribution Basis
rule_text: UA National Wellness & Organization will be paid on hours worked .
summary: Contributions for the UA National Wellness & Organization (UAW&O) fund are calculated based on hours worked, not hours earned.
logical_representation: IF benefit_type (llm) == 'UAW&O' -> SET_CALCULATION_BASIS('HOURS_WORKED')
reasoning: This rule specifies the calculation method for a specific benefit fund, which is a key part of processing worked time and wages.

name: Fraternal & Building Dues
rule_text: Fraternal & Building dues 18¢ are earned and to be deducted from wages and remitted at same time and in same manner as Union dues, per the most recent ratified ICI Collective Agreement.
summary: A deduction of $0.18 per hour earned is to be made from employee wages for Fraternal & Building dues.
logical_representation: DEDUCTION(0.18) PER 'HOURS_EARNED' FOR 'FRATERNAL_AND_BUILDING_DUES'
reasoning: This rule specifies a per-hour deduction from wages, which is a direct modification of labor pay based on time.

name: BTA Dues
rule_text: BTA dues of 6¢ per hour earned to be deducted from wages and remitted at same time and in same manner as Union dues.
summary: A deduction of $0.06 per hour earned is to be made from employee wages for BTA dues.
logical_representation: DEDUCTION(0.06) PER 'HOURS_EARNED' FOR 'BTA_DUES'
reasoning: This rule outlines a per-hour deduction from wages, directly affecting the net pay for worked time.

name: Industrial Pay Schedule
rule_text: Pay day shall be once each week, and not more than five (5) days pay may be held back, unless other arrangements are made between the Employer and the Union.
summary: For industrial work, employees must be paid weekly, and the employer can hold back no more than five days' worth of pay.
logical_representation: IF work_category (llm) == 'INDUSTRIAL' -> SET(pay_frequency (llm)) = 'WEEKLY' AND CONSTRAINT(pay_holdback_days (llm) <= 5)
reasoning: This rule defines the frequency and terms of payment for labor, which is a fundamental condition of employment and payroll processing.

name: Industrial Pay Error Penalty
rule_text: If the Employer has been notified at least one (1) working day prior to payroll cut off for the next pay period and the correction(s) is/are not made, there will be a penalty equivalent of two (2) hours at base rate, for every working day until the correction(s) is/are made beyond payday.
summary: If an employer is notified of a pay error in time but fails to correct it by the next payday, they must pay a penalty of two hours' pay at the base rate for each working day the correction remains outstanding.
logical_representation: IF work_category (llm) == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND payroll_error_reported (llm) == true AND payroll_error_corrected (llm) == false -> PENALTY(2 * base_rate) PER 'WORKING_DAY' OF DELAY
reasoning: This rule establishes a financial penalty related to the accuracy and timeliness of paying for worked hours, making it a labor time rule.

name: Final Pay on Layoff or Discharge
rule_text: When Employees are laid off or discharged, they shall be paid the wages due to them at the time of layoff or discharge and given their Record of Employment and Apprenticeship Book, if applicable, except in the case where the Employer has not established a pay office at the jobsite, payment will be mailed within two (2) working days.
summary: Upon layoff or discharge, an employee must receive their final pay immediately. If there is no on-site pay office, the employer must mail the final payment within two working days.
logical_representation: IF employee_status (Unsupported) IN ['LAID_OFF', 'DISCHARGED'] AND onsite_pay_office (llm) == true -> PAY(final_wages) AT TIME(termination). IF employee_status (Unsupported) IN ['LAID_OFF', 'DISCHARGED'] AND onsite_pay_office (llm) == false -> PAY(final_wages) WITHIN 2 'WORKING_DAYS'
reasoning: This rule governs the timing and procedure for the final payment of wages, a critical step in the conclusion of labor time accounting.

name: Penalty for Late Final Pay
rule_text: Failure to do so will result in a penalty of four (4) hours at the applicable basic hourly rate of pay for each 24-hour period of delay beyond the two working days within which the pay should have been postmarked.
summary: If an employer fails to mail an employee's final pay within the required two-day window after being notified of the delay, they are penalized four hours of pay at the base rate for each 24-hour period the payment is late.
logical_representation: IF employee_status (Unsupported) IN ['LAID_OFF', 'DISCHARGED'] AND final_pay_is_late (llm) == true -> PENALTY(4 * base_rate) PER '24_HOUR_PERIOD' OF DELAY
reasoning: This rule applies a monetary penalty for failing to pay for labor in a timely manner, directly tying it to worked time and compensation.

name: Final Pay on Voluntary Termination
rule_text: When an Employee voluntarily terminates their employment, the Employer will mail their wages to their last known address without undue delay but no later than two (2) working days after termination.
summary: When an employee quits, the employer is required to mail their final wages to their last known address within two working days of the termination.
logical_representation: IF employee_status (Unsupported) == 'TERMINATED' -> PAY(final_wages) WITHIN 2 'WORKING_DAYS'
reasoning: This rule specifies the timeline for final wage payment, a key administrative rule for processing an employee's final hours.

name: Final Pay via Direct Deposit
rule_text: For the purposes of this Article, where an Employer is utilizing electronic banking, the above clauses will apply to the Employees of that Employer with the exception of those Employees who have selected to be paid by direct deposit. In this case the final pay will be paid on the next regular pay day when the time owing would have been normally payable.
summary: For employees who use direct deposit, the rules for immediate final pay upon termination do not apply. Instead, their final wages will be deposited on the next scheduled regular payday.
logical_representation: IF employee_status (Unsupported) IN ['LAID_OFF', 'DISCHARGED', 'TERMINATED'] AND is_direct_deposit_user (llm) == true -> PAY(final_wages) ON 'NEXT_REGULAR_PAYDAY'
reasoning: This rule creates an exception to standard final pay timing based on payment method, directly affecting the payment schedule for worked time.

name: General Contribution Basis - Industrial Work
rule_text: For INDUSTRIAL work, notwithstanding anything contained elsewhere in this Agreement, all contributions to the separate following trust funds shall be payable by the Employer on the Employee's total actual hours EARNED including overtime.
summary: For all industrial work, employer contributions to the listed trust funds must be calculated based on an employee's total hours earned, which includes overtime hours.
logical_representation: IF work_category (llm) == 'INDUSTRIAL' -> SET_CALCULATION_BASIS('HOURS_EARNED') FOR ALL_TRUST_FUNDS
reasoning: This is a high-level rule defining the fundamental basis ('hours earned') for calculating all benefit contributions for a major work category, directly impacting labor cost calculations.

name: Pay for Multiple Tests (Hired vs Not Hired)
rule_text: In the event the worker is required to take multiple tests and passes some of the tests but fails others they will be paid as above if hired or will be paid for the time taken on successful tests if not hired.
summary: If a worker takes multiple tests with mixed results (pass/fail), their pay depends on their hiring status. If hired, they are paid according to the standard test day rules. If not hired, they are only paid for the time spent on the tests they passed.
logical_representation: IF is_multi_test_scenario (llm) == true AND test_result (Unsupported) == 'MIXED' AND employee_status (Unsupported) == 'HIRED' -> APPLY_PAY_RULES('TEST_DAY') ELSE IF is_multi_test_scenario (llm) == true AND test_result (Unsupported) == 'MIXED' AND employee_status (Unsupported) == 'NOT_HIRED' -> PAY(HOURS_FOR_PASSED_TESTS_ONLY)
reasoning: This rule provides two distinct methods for calculating compensable hours based on employment status, making it a worked time rule.

name: Alloy Welder Premium Lock-in on 3rd Reclassification
rule_text: The worker may only be reclassified to a maximum of 2 times in a calendar year, if the worker is reclassified a 3rd time within the calendar year the worker is entitled to the premium for all hours worked from the date of the employee being reclassified a 3rd time, until the worker is laid off or terminated.
summary: A worker can be temporarily reclassified as an alloy welder twice a year. If they are reclassified a third time in the same year, they will permanently receive the alloy premium for all hours worked until they are laid off or terminated.
logical_representation: IF reclassification_count_in_year (llm) == 3 -> PREMIUM($3.25_FOR_ALL_HOURS_UNTIL_TERMINATION_OR_LAYOFF)
reasoning: This rule establishes a condition that triggers a long-term, continuous premium payment, directly impacting the calculation of the rate for worked hours.

name: Statutory Holiday Pay (In Lieu)
rule_text: In lieu of pay for the above recognized holidays the Employer shall pay an additional 4% to the Employee's total hourly earnings each week, including overtime hours and premium time hours.
summary: Instead of receiving pay for each individual holiday, employees receive an additional 4% of their total weekly hourly earnings (including overtime and premium hours) on each paycheck.
logical_representation: PAY(total_weekly_earnings (llm) * 0.04) AS stat_holiday_pay (llm)
reasoning: This rule defines a specific calculation for holiday pay, which is a component of the overall compensation for labor time.

name: Vacation Pay Calculation and Payout
rule_text: Employees annual Vacation Pay shall be 6% of the Employee's total hourly earnings. Such total hourly earnings shall be deemed to include straight time hours, overtime hours, premium time hours and shall be paid each pay period with the Employee's regular pay.
summary: Employees receive vacation pay calculated at 6% of their total hourly earnings, which includes straight time, overtime, and premium hours. This amount is paid out with their regular wages each pay period.
logical_representation: PAY(total_hourly_earnings (llm) * 0.06) AS vacation_pay (llm) PER pay_period (llm)
reasoning: This rule outlines the calculation and payout frequency for vacation pay, which is directly tied to hours worked and earnings, making it a rule about compensation for labor time.

name: VHP/SHP Payout Decision Mechanism (Calgary 496)
rule_text: Whether the Employees receive the above noted holiday and vacation pay each pay period, or whether the vacation and holiday pay are to be retained by the Employer and paid to each Employee at the time of the Employee's vacation or on the last pay day in the calendar year or upon termination of the Employee's employment (whichever occurs first), shall be determined by a majority vote of the Employees of that Employer.
summary: For applicable work in the Calgary 496 jurisdiction, the choice of how vacation and holiday pay is paid out (either per paycheck or retained for later payout) is determined by a majority vote of the employees.
logical_representation: IF jurisdiction (Unsupported) == 'CALGARY_496' -> DECISION(payout_method_for_vhp_shp (llm), 'EMPLOYEE_MAJORITY_VOTE')
reasoning: This rule establishes the procedure for selecting a payout method for earnings derived from labor time, which is an administrative rule for compensation.

name: Standard Unpaid Lunch Break
rule_text: The lunch break will consist of a one-half hour unpaid break taken approximately mid-way during the regular workday.
summary: Employees are entitled to a 30-minute unpaid lunch break, taken around the middle of their regular workday.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT(LUNCH_BREAK_DURATION == 30_MINUTES) AND CONSTRAINT(LUNCH_BREAK_IS_UNPAID)
reasoning: This rule defines the duration and pay status of a standard break within the workday, which is a core component of how worked time is structured.

name: Delayed Lunch Break Penalty
rule_text: If the lunch break is delayed such that it starts more than one-half hour after the completion of the normal lunch break, the Employee will be paid an additional one-half hour at their applicable straight time rate for the one-half hour lunch break.
summary: If an employee's lunch break starts more than 30 minutes after its normally scheduled end time, they will be paid for their 30-minute lunch break at their straight-time rate.
logical_representation: IF lunch_break_delay_minutes (llm) > 30 -> PAY(0.5_HOURS_ST)
reasoning: This rule mandates a specific payment (0.5 hours at ST) when a condition related to the timing of a work break is met. This directly affects labor cost and is a worked time rule.

name: Standard Coffee Breaks
rule_text: All Employees covered by this agreement shall be permitted ten (10) minutes in the first half and ten (10) minutes in the second half of a shift for a coffee break on the job during regular working hours.
summary: Employees are entitled to two 10-minute paid coffee breaks during regular working hours, one in the first half and one in the second half of their shift.
logical_representation: PROVIDE(PAID_BREAK(10_minutes, 'first_half_shift')) AND PROVIDE(PAID_BREAK(10_minutes, 'second_half_shift'))
reasoning: This rule defines paid breaks, which are an integral part of calculating total paid time for a shift.

name: Missed Break Penalty (General)
rule_text: In the event an employee is not able to take a break, the employee shall be paid at applicable overtime rates for the missed break.
summary: If an employee cannot take their scheduled break, they must be paid for the duration of the missed break at the applicable overtime rate.
logical_representation: IF break_missed (llm) == true -> PAY(missed_break_duration AT APPLICABLE_OT_RATE)
reasoning: This rule creates a direct payment obligation at a premium rate when a break entitlement is not fulfilled. This is a rule for calculating paid time.

name: Missed Break Penalty (Straight Time Context)
rule_text: When the hour before and the hour following the missed break are at straight tine, time and one half (1 ½ x) shall be paid for the missed break.
summary: If an employee misses a break during a period when they are being paid straight time, the missed break time must be paid at time and a half (1.5x).
logical_representation: IF break_missed (llm) == true AND surrounding_hours_pay_rate (llm) == 'ST' -> PAY(missed_break_duration AT 1.5x)
reasoning: This rule specifies the exact premium (1.5x) for a missed break under specific conditions (surrounding hours are ST), making it a precise labor cost calculation rule.

name: Pay for Waiting Time on Negative POCT Result (Sample Provided)
rule_text: If an employer requests a worker to participate in a POCT risk assessment pursuant to 4.8.5 of the Canadian Model , and the worker provides the urine sample, and the laboratory drug test result is negative, the worker shall be paid for any time the worker would have otherwise worked while waiting for the laboratory result, except for such discipline that was justified by the worker's conduct in respect to the incident or reasons for the test request.
summary: If an employee provides a sample for a Point of Collection Test (POCT) and the result is negative, they will be paid for the time they were waiting for the result that they would have otherwise been working. This pay can be withheld if discipline was warranted for the employee's conduct related to the incident that triggered the test.
logical_representation: IF test (Unsupported) == 'POCT' AND sample_provided (llm) == true AND test_result (Unsupported) == 'NEGATIVE' AND discipline_warranted (llm) == false -> PAY(waiting_time_as_worked_time)
reasoning: This rule dictates when non-productive waiting time becomes compensable, making it a rule about calculating paid hours.

name: No Pay for Waiting Time on POCT Result (Sample Declined)
rule_text: If the worker declines to provide the sample for the POCT risk assessment and the laboratory drug test result is negative, the worker shall not be entitled to any pay for time the worker would have otherwise worked while waiting for the laboratory result.
summary: If an employee declines to provide an initial sample for a Point of Collection Test (POCT), they will not be paid for any time spent waiting for the subsequent laboratory test result, even if it comes back negative.
logical_representation: IF test (Unsupported) == 'POCT' AND sample_provided (llm) == false -> FORFEIT(PAY_FOR_WAITING_TIME)
reasoning: This rule explicitly defines a scenario where time is not compensable, directly impacting the calculation of total paid hours.

name: Employer Start/Quit Time Variation
rule_text: The Employer may vary the start/quit times by changing the scheduled starting time up to one hour at their option.
summary: The employer has the option to change the scheduled start and end times by up to one hour.
logical_representation: IF shift_start_time_change_hours (llm) <= 1 -> ALLOW(EMPLOYER_DISCRETION)
reasoning: This rule directly impacts the definition of the standard workday by allowing for schedule adjustments, which affects how daily hours are tracked and categorized.

name: Start/Quit Time Variation Over One Hour
rule_text: Variances beyond one (1) hour shall be agreed mutually by the Employer and the Business Representative of the Union and the consent to variance will not be unreasonably withheld.
summary: Any changes to start and end times that are greater than one hour must be mutually agreed upon by the Employer and the Union.
logical_representation: IF shift_start_time_change_hours (llm) > 1 -> REQUIRE(MUTUAL_AGREEMENT)
reasoning: This rule sets a condition for making significant changes to the work schedule, which is a core component of defining and managing worked time.

name: Consistent Application of Schedule Changes
rule_text: A  change  in  start/quit  times  shall  be  applied  consistently  on  the  jobsite...
summary: Any changes to shift start and end times must be applied consistently to everyone on the jobsite.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT(APPLY_SCHEDULE_CHANGE_CONSISTENTLY_ON_JOBSITE)
reasoning: This is a constraint on how schedule changes are implemented, ensuring fairness in the application of work hours across a site.

name: Prohibition of Split Shifts
rule_text: ...and  in  no circumstances shall split shifts be created, unless mutually agreed between the parties.
summary: Split shifts are not allowed unless the Employer and the Union mutually agree to them.
logical_representation: IF is_split_shift (llm) == true -> REQUIRE(MUTUAL_AGREEMENT)
reasoning: This rule governs the structure of the workday, preventing non-continuous work periods which fundamentally alters how daily worked time is defined.

name: Pre-Shift Work as Overtime
rule_text: When  an  Employee  is  required  to  work  prior  to  the commencement of their regular shift, such time shall be considered as overtime.
summary: Any time an employee is required to work before their regular shift starts is automatically considered overtime.
logical_representation: IF work_start_status (Unsupported) == 'PRE_SHIFT' -> TRANSITION(OT)
reasoning: This rule specifies a special condition where work is immediately classified as overtime, overriding the normal daily hour thresholds. It's a direct rule about categorizing worked time.

name: Minor Start/Quit Time Variation
rule_text: The Employer may vary the start/quit times by changing the scheduled starting time up to thirty minutes at their option.
summary: The employer has the right to adjust the scheduled start time by up to 30 minutes without requiring agreement.
logical_representation: IF start_time_variance_minutes (llm) <= 30 -> ALLOW(employer_discretion)
reasoning: This rule governs the scheduling of work hours, a key aspect of defining the workday and how time is recorded.

name: Major Start/Quit Time Variation
rule_text: Variances beyond thirty minutes shall be agreed mutually by the Employer and the Business Representative of the Union.
summary: Any changes to the start time greater than 30 minutes must be mutually agreed upon by the employer and the union.
logical_representation: IF start_time_variance_minutes (llm) > 30 -> REQUIRE(mutual_agreement)
reasoning: This rule places a condition on the scheduling of work hours, which is integral to the categorization of worked time.

name: Split Shift Prohibition
rule_text: A change in start/quit times shall be applied consistently on the jobsite and in no circumstances shall split shifts be created, unless mutually agreed between the parties.
summary: Changes to start and end times must be applied consistently across the jobsite, and creating split shifts is forbidden unless mutually agreed upon.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT(NO_SPLIT_SHIFTS) UNLESS mutual_agreement == true
reasoning: This rule constrains how work shifts can be structured, a fundamental aspect of defining and categorizing worked time.

name: Notice for Change in Work Hours
rule_text: When job circumstances merit a change in the hours of work, the Employer shall notify the Union office at least seven (7) calendar days, where practical, before such change becomes effective.
summary: If job conditions require a change in the hours of work, the employer must notify the union office at least seven calendar days in advance, whenever practical.
logical_representation: IF change_in_work_hours (llm) == true -> REQUIRE(employer_notifies_union_7_days_prior)
reasoning: This rule dictates the notification process for altering work schedules, which is an administrative aspect of managing labor time.

name: Personal Time Off Request
rule_text: An employee who has not been absent, including late arrivals or early quits, or granted leave in the previous calendar 30 days, and who gives the Employer at least three working days' notice of a request for leave of up to one day, will be granted the requested leave.
summary: An employee can be granted up to one day of personal leave if they have a clean attendance record for the past 30 days and provide at least three working days' notice.
logical_representation: IF prior_30_day_attendance_perfect (llm) == true AND notice_days (llm) >= 3 AND leave_duration_days (llm) <= 1 -> GRANT(personal_leave)
reasoning: This rule defines the conditions for taking time off, which affects the calculation of total worked hours and eligibility for weekly overtime.

name: Pre-Authorized Absence and Weekly Overtime
rule_text: It is also understood that, provided such absences conform to these conditions, the absence will not disqualify the worker from working overtime scheduled for that week.
summary: A pre-authorized personal day off does not disqualify a worker from being able to work other scheduled overtime during that same week.
logical_representation: IF is_absence_preauthorized (Unsupported) == true -> RETAIN(eligibility_for_weekly_overtime_work)
reasoning: This rule defines how absences affect eligibility for weekly overtime, directly impacting the administration of worked time.

name: Unexcused Absence and Overtime Disqualification
rule_text: A worker that is absent from work without pre-authorization as per the above procedure, including late arrivals or early quits will be subject to discipline in accordance with their employer's policies and may also be disqualified from working scheduled overtime in the week the absence occurs.
summary: An unexcused absence, including being late or leaving early, can result in discipline and may disqualify the worker from any scheduled overtime for that week.
logical_representation: IF is_absence_preauthorized (Unsupported) == false -> FORFEIT(weekly_scheduled_overtime_work)
reasoning: This rule connects attendance (an aspect of labor time) with eligibility for overtime hours, thus it pertains to the administration of worked time.

name: Excusable Absence Definition
rule_text: The employee will notify the employer prior to shift start time, to be accepted as an excusable absence when circumstances arise beyond the workers' control.
summary: An absence is considered excusable if it's due to circumstances beyond the worker's control and the employee notifies the employer before their shift starts.
logical_representation: IF notification_before_shift_start (llm) == true AND reason_beyond_control (llm) == true -> SET(absence=excusable)
reasoning: This rule defines what constitutes an excusable absence, which is critical for determining overtime eligibility as per other rules. It's an integral part of managing worked time.

name: Call Out Pay, No Work Commenced
rule_text: Employees who have completed the day's scheduled hours of work and left the jobsite to return home or to camp and who respond to a request to work additional time, shall be compensated as follows. (a) Employees who do not commence work shall be paid for two (2) hours at the applicable overtime rate, and any travel and transportation applicable.
summary: An employee who has finished their shift, left the site, and is then called back but does not start work, must be paid for a minimum of two hours at the overtime rate, plus any applicable travel costs.
logical_representation: IF is_call_out (llm) == true AND work_commenced (Unsupported) == false -> PAY(MIN(2_HOURS_OT)) AND PAY(TRAVEL_COST)
reasoning: This rule establishes a minimum payment guarantee for a specific work scenario (a call-out where no work is performed), which falls under the category of how worked/guaranteed time is compensated.

name: Call Out Pay, Work Commenced Minimum
rule_text: Employees who are called in and commence work shall be paid for a minimum of three (3) hours at the applicable overtime rate and any travel and transportation applicable.
summary: An employee who is called back to the site after their shift and begins working is guaranteed a minimum payment of three hours at the overtime rate, in addition to any applicable travel costs.
logical_representation: IF is_call_out (llm) == true AND work_commenced (Unsupported) == true -> PAY(MIN(3_HOURS_OT)) AND PAY(TRAVEL_COST)
reasoning: This rule sets a minimum payment guarantee for time worked under specific conditions (a call-out), which is a core function of the LABOR_WORKED_TIME topic.

name: Call Out Pay, Exceeding Minimum
rule_text: Where an Employee works more than the three (3) hours set out in 18.01 (b) above, the Employee shall receive remuneration for the hours actually worked at the applicable overtime rates and any travel or transportation applicable.
summary: If an employee on a call-out works for more than the three-hour minimum, they are to be paid for all the hours they actually worked at the applicable overtime rate, plus any travel costs.
logical_representation: IF is_call_out (llm) == true AND work_commenced (Unsupported) == true AND call_out_hours_worked (llm) > 3 -> PAY(call_out_hours_worked (llm) * OT_RATE) AND PAY(TRAVEL_COST)
reasoning: This rule defines how hours worked beyond a minimum guarantee are calculated and paid, which is a direct aspect of categorizing and compensating labor time.

name: Rest Period After Call Out
rule_text: In the event that an Employee, responding to a call out does not get an eight (8) hour break, prior to the commencement of their regular workday, the Employee(s) shall be allowed an eight (8) hour rest break and be paid for a normally scheduled workday. To qualify for the normally scheduled days pay the Employee shall be available for work at the end of the eight (8) hour break.
summary: If a call-out prevents an employee from getting an eight-hour break before their next regular shift, they are entitled to an eight-hour rest break. They will be paid for their normal workday provided they are available to work immediately after this rest period ends.
logical_representation: IF is_call_out (llm) == true AND break_between_shifts_hours (llm) < 8 AND is_available_for_work (llm) == true -> PROVIDE(8_HOUR_REST_BREAK) AND PAY(NORMAL_SCHEDULED_WORKDAY)
reasoning: This rule provides an entitlement for a paid rest period and payment for a regular workday under specific circumstances related to insufficient rest. This falls under LABOR_WORKED_TIME as it dictates how time is compensated due to work scheduling conflicts.

name: Shift Premium for Partial Weeks
rule_text: Where a shift is commenced and has run for at least the four (4) or five (5) consecutive days referred to above, should the shift terminate in the middle of the week, or an Employee hires on in a week in which a shift ends, affected Employee(s) shall only be entitled to shift premium on regular hours of work.
summary: If a qualifying shift ends mid-week or an employee is hired mid-week, the shift premium is only paid on their regular (straight-time) hours for that week.
logical_representation: IF shift_termination_midweek (llm) == true OR employee_status (Unsupported) == 'NEW_HIRE' -> PREMIUM(SHIFT_PREMIUM_ON_ST_HOURS_ONLY)
reasoning: This rule specifies the conditions under which a premium is applied to hours worked, which is a core component of labor time calculation and compensation.

name: Single Shift per 24-Hour Period
rule_text: No Employee shall work more than one (1) straight time shift in each consecutive twenty-four (24) hour period.
summary: An employee is not permitted to work more than one straight-time shift within any 24-hour period.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT(number_of_st_shifts_in_24h (llm) <= 1)
reasoning: This rule establishes a constraint on work scheduling that directly relates to how hours are categorized and paid, preventing multiple straight-time periods in a short timeframe.

name: Overtime Until 8-Hour Rest Break
rule_text: An Employee shall continue to receive the overtime rate, plus shift differential, after each shift until a break of eight (8) consecutive hours occurs, exclusive of travel allowance.
summary: If an employee does not receive at least an 8-hour consecutive break between shifts, all hours worked until that break occurs will be paid at the overtime rate plus any applicable shift differential.
logical_representation: IF rest_period_hours (llm) < 8 -> TRANSITION(OT_PLUS_SHIFT_DIFFERENTIAL)
reasoning: This rule defines a condition (insufficient rest) that triggers overtime pay, directly impacting the classification and payment of worked hours.

name: Pay for Day Lost Due to Shift Change
rule_text: When an Employee loses a regular day through the implementation or termination of shift work, then the Employee shall be paid a regular days pay for the day lost.
summary: If an employee loses a scheduled workday because of the start or end of a shift work schedule, they must be paid for that lost day.
logical_representation: IF shift_change_causes_lost_day (llm) == true -> PAY(ONE_REGULAR_DAY)
reasoning: This rule provides a payment entitlement for time not actually worked but lost due to scheduling changes, which is a form of guaranteed pay related to labor time.

name: Shift Premium for Irregular Single Shifts
rule_text: Where the owner/client may require work to be done on a single shift basis at start/quit times that may be at variance with the start/quit for a regular shift, single shift operations shall be permitted subject to the payment of shift differential. The shift differential shall be paid on all hours worked.
summary: If a client requires a single shift with non-standard start and end times, a shift differential must be paid for all hours worked on that shift.
logical_representation: IF is_irregular_single_shift (Unsupported) == true -> PREMIUM(SHIFT_DIFFERENTIAL_ON_ALL_HOURS)
reasoning: This rule mandates a premium payment based on the specific scheduling characteristics of the work, directly affecting the pay rate for worked time.

name: Payment for Overtime Meal Consumption Time
rule_text: The cost of the meal(s) and the time consuming same shall be paid for at the straight time rates contained in this Agreement, to a maximum of one half (½) hour in duration.
summary: The employer pays for the overtime meal itself and for the time taken to eat it, up to a maximum of 30 minutes, at the employee's straight-time rate.
logical_representation: ON (PROVIDE(MEAL)) -> PAY(MEAL_COST) AND PAY(0.5_HOURS_ST)
reasoning: This rule defines the compensation associated with the meal entitlement (cost of meal and paid time to eat), which is directly related to the meal allowance topic.

name: Overtime Meal Entitlement on Subsistence Jobs
rule_text: Where the Employer is paying subsistence, this clause shall also apply.
summary: The overtime meal rules apply even when the employee is already receiving a subsistence allowance from the employer.
logical_representation: IF is_receiving_subsistence (llm) == true -> APPLY_RULE(20.01)
reasoning: This rule clarifies the applicability of meal allowance rules under another specific condition (receiving subsistence), thus it's categorized under meal allowances.

name: Union Notification for Break Adjustments
rule_text: In such cases the Union will be notified prior to the breaks being adjusted.
summary: The employer must inform the Union before changing break times on shifts where the camp supper meal exception is in effect.
logical_representation: ON (ADJUST_BREAK_TIMES) -> REQUIRE(NOTIFY_UNION)
reasoning: This is a procedural requirement related to the adjustment of break times, which is part of managing worked time.

name: Show Up Time Minimum Pay
rule_text: When an Employee reports to work at the regular starting time and such Employee is not put to work,  the  Employee  so  affected  shall  be  entitled  to  a  minimum  of  two  (2)  hours  pay  at  the applicable rate of pay.
summary: If an employee reports for their regular shift but is not put to work, they are guaranteed a minimum of two hours of pay at their applicable rate.
logical_representation: IF reports_for_work (llm) == true AND is_put_to_work (llm) == false -> PAY(MIN(2_HOURS))
reasoning: This rule establishes a minimum payment guarantee for an employee who reports to work but is not provided with any, which is a form of guaranteed worked time.

name: Show Up Time On-Site Requirement
rule_text: In  order  to  qualify  for  show  up  time,  Employees  must  remain  on  the  jobsite  unless  otherwise directed by the Employer.
summary: To receive show-up pay, employees must stay on the jobsite unless the employer instructs them to leave.
logical_representation: IF employee_remains_on_site (llm) == false -> FORFEIT(SHOW_UP_PAY)
reasoning: This rule sets a condition for the eligibility of show-up pay, directly affecting whether an employee is compensated for their time, thus falling under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Extended Wait Time Pay
rule_text: Where the Employee(s) are directed to remain at the jobsite for more than two (2) hours, including wait times for company supplied transportation to leave site, they shall be paid for such time at the applicable rate.
summary: If an employee is required to wait on the jobsite for more than two hours (including waiting for company transport), they must be paid for the entire duration of the wait.
logical_representation: IF wait_time_on_site_hours (llm) > 2 -> PAY(wait_time_on_site_hours (llm))
reasoning: This rule mandates payment for time spent waiting on-site beyond a specific threshold, making it a rule about compensable labor time.

name: Show Up Time and Allowances
rule_text: Employee(s)  affected  shall  be  paid  daily  travel,  transportation,  subsistence  or  receive  camp accommodation as is applicable.
summary: Employees who qualify for show-up pay are also entitled to receive their applicable daily travel, transportation, subsistence, or camp accommodation benefits.
logical_representation: IF is_show_up_time_qualified (llm) == true -> PROVIDE(TRAVEL_ALLOWANCE) AND PROVIDE(TRANSPORTATION_ALLOWANCE) AND PROVIDE(SUBSISTENCE_ALLOWANCE) AND PROVIDE(CAMP_ACCOMMODATION)
reasoning: This rule directly concerns the provision of subsistence, travel, and accommodation allowances, which falls under the LABOR_SUBSISTENCE_ALLOWANCE topic.

name: Show Up Time Notification Exception
rule_text: An Employee is not entitled to show up time if the Employer notifies the Employee that no work is available at least two (2) hours prior to the commencement of the normal workday.
summary: An employee is not eligible for show-up pay if the employer informs them of the lack of work at least two hours before their normal start time.
logical_representation: IF notification_of_no_work_hours_prior (llm) >= 2 -> FORFEIT(SHOW_UP_PAY)
reasoning: This rule provides an exception to the show-up pay entitlement based on timely notification, making it a conditional rule about guaranteed labor payments.

name: Show Up Time Camp Notification Exception
rule_text: Employees working on a jobsite where they are accommodated in a camp facility will not be entitled to show up time if they are notified that no work is available, at breakfast time, and notices are posted on the bulletin boards in the camp kitchen.
summary: Employees living in a work camp are not entitled to show-up pay if they are notified at breakfast and a notice is posted in the camp kitchen that there is no work available.
logical_representation: IF is_camp_employee (llm) == true AND is_notified_at_breakfast (llm) == true AND is_notice_posted (llm) == true -> FORFEIT(SHOW_UP_PAY)
reasoning: This rule specifies a particular set of conditions for camp-based employees that negates the show-up pay entitlement, thereby defining when guaranteed work time is not paid.

name: Show Up Time and Shift Premium
rule_text: When an Employee reporting for work qualifies for show up time such time shall include the regular shift premium when applicable.
summary: When an employee receives show-up pay, that pay must include any applicable regular shift premium.
logical_representation: IF is_show_up_time_qualified (llm) == true AND has_shift_premium (llm) == true -> PAY(SHOW_UP_HOURS_WITH_PREMIUM)
reasoning: This rule defines the calculation method for show-up pay, specifically the inclusion of premiums, which is a core component of how worked or guaranteed time is compensated.

name: Definition of Local Resident
rule_text: A local resident is an individual who resides within a seventy-five (75) kilometer radius of the  centre  of  a  job  site  which  is  beyond  daily  commuting  distance  from  Edmonton  or Calgary or other locations where a hiring hall is located and, has resided within such radius of the site for a period of not less than six months prior to being engaged on the project.
summary: A local resident is defined as someone who has lived for at least six months within a 75 km radius of a job site, provided the site is outside daily commuting distance from a major city or hiring hall location.
logical_representation: IF job_location_radius_km (Unsupported) <= 75 AND residency_duration_months (llm) >= 6 AND project_distance_from_hiring_hall (Unsupported) > daily_commuting_distance (llm) -> SET(is_local_resident (Unsupported), true)
reasoning: This rule defines the criteria for being a 'local resident', which is the primary condition for eligibility for various subsistence, travel, and accommodation allowances. Therefore, it is classified under LABOR_SUBSISTENCE_ALLOWANCE.

name: Forfeiture of Allowances for Local Residents within 45km
rule_text: Local Residents residing within a forty-five (45) km radius of the job site shall not be entitled to receive transportation or vehicle allowance, travel allowance, initial and return travel allowance, room and board, subsistence, camp accommodations, or rotational leave provisions.
summary: Local residents who live within a 45 km radius of the job site are not eligible for any transportation, travel, living, or accommodation allowances, nor are they entitled to rotational leave.
logical_representation: IF is_local_resident (Unsupported) == true AND job_location_radius_km (Unsupported) <= 45 -> FORFEIT('transportation_allowance', 'vehicle_allowance', 'travel_allowance', 'initial_and_return_travel_allowance', 'room_and_board', 'subsistence', 'camp_accommodations', 'rotational_leave')
reasoning: This rule explicitly removes entitlement to various monetary and in-kind allowances related to living out and travel based on the employee's proximity to the worksite. This falls directly under the category of LABOR_SUBSISTENCE_ALLOWANCE.

name: Fort McMurray Area Residency Equivalency
rule_text: For the purposes of determining local residents in the Fort McMurray area, residents of Anzac and Saprae Creek will be considered to be residents of Fort McMurray for projects north of Fort McMurray and residents of Fort McKay will be considered to be residents of Fort McMurray for projects located south of Fort McMurray
summary: For determining local residency near Fort McMurray, residents of Anzac/Saprae Creek are treated as Fort McMurray residents for projects to the north, and Fort McKay residents are treated as Fort McMurray residents for projects to the south.
logical_representation: IF (project_location (Unsupported) == 'NORTH_OF_FORT_MCMURRAY' AND employee_residence_location (llm) IN ['Anzac', 'Saprae Creek']) OR (project_location (Unsupported) == 'SOUTH_OF_FORT_MCMURRAY' AND employee_residence_location (llm) == 'Fort McKay') -> CONDITION(is_local_resident (Unsupported) based on Fort McMurray)
reasoning: This rule modifies the definition and determination of local residency status for specific geographic areas. Since local residency is the key condition for subsistence and travel allowances, this rule belongs to the LABOR_SUBSISTENCE_ALLOWANCE topic.

name: Noon Meal for Local Residents from Camp Kitchen
rule_text: Where a Camp Kitchen is established, and where all workers generally on the project who are not Local Residents attend at the Camp Kitchen to eat their lunches a Local Resident Employee shall be provided the same noon meal without cost to himself.
summary: If a project has a camp kitchen that is used by all non-local workers for lunch, then local resident employees must also be provided with the same noon meal for free.
logical_representation: IF is_local_resident (Unsupported) == true AND camp_kitchen_established (llm) == true AND non_local_workers_use_camp_kitchen (llm) == true -> PROVIDE(noon_meal)
reasoning: This rule dictates the provision of a meal under specific circumstances, which is a direct meal entitlement. Thus, it is classified as LABOR_MEAL_ALLOWANCE.

name: Hot Soup for Local Residents
rule_text: In those instances where bagged lunches are provided to camp residents and hot soup is delivered to the jobsite, local residents shall be entitled to pick up hot soup as well.
summary: If camp residents receive bagged lunches and hot soup is delivered to the site, local residents are also entitled to get the hot soup.
logical_representation: IF is_local_resident (Unsupported) == true AND bagged_lunches_provided (llm) == true AND hot_soup_delivered_to_site (llm) == true -> PROVIDE(hot_soup)
reasoning: This rule provides entitlement to a specific food item (hot soup) under certain conditions, making it a LABOR_MEAL_ALLOWANCE.

name: Guidelines for Determining Real Residency
rule_text: In making the determination as to whether a person is a 'Local Resident' for the purposes of the Collective Agreement, the following factors will be taken into consideration:  the dwelling place of the person's spouse and dependents;  personal property and social ties to the community;  residential ties elsewhere;  performance and purpose of residence in a particular community;  documentation of; (i) property tax and rent receipts, telephone, gas or other utility receipts; (ii) driver's license; (iii) vehicle registration or pink card; (iv) income tax; (v) unemployment insurance documents; (vi) voters' list registration; (vii) employee benefit fund administration registrations.
summary: To determine if a person qualifies as a 'Local Resident,' several factors are considered, including the location of their family, community ties, other residences, and various official documents like driver's licenses, utility bills, and tax records.
logical_representation: DETERMINE(is_local_resident (Unsupported)) BASED_ON('spouse_dependents_dwelling', 'community_ties', 'residential_ties_elsewhere', 'residence_purpose', 'documentation_proof')
reasoning: This rule outlines the criteria and evidence used to establish 'local resident' status. This determination is the prerequisite for all subsistence, travel, and accommodation allowances, placing it firmly within the LABOR_SUBSISTENCE_ALLOWANCE topic.

name: Daily Travel Free Zone
rule_text: A forty-five (45) kilometer radius free zone from the center of the cities of Edmonton or Calgary; (Geodetic Monument) or around any place in which Employees are temporarily domiciled by the Employer shall be established.  The location of the Geodetic Monument for Edmonton is 101 Street and Jasper Avenue and for Calgary, the Calgary Tower.  No transportation or travel allowance shall be applicable within the free zone
summary: No transportation or travel allowance is paid for work within a 45km radius of the center of Edmonton, Calgary, or any temporary accommodation provided by the employer.
logical_representation: IF job_location_radius_km (Unsupported) <= 45 FROM domicile_location (llm) WHERE domicile_location (llm) IN ('EDMONTON_CENTRE', 'CALGARY_CENTRE', 'EMPLOYER_PROVIDED_ACCOMMODATION') -> FORFEIT('transportation_allowance', 'travel_allowance')
reasoning: This rule defines a geographic area where a monetary allowance (travel allowance) is not applicable, which falls under the category of subsistence and remote work entitlements.

name: Major Project Transportation Review
rule_text: Notwithstanding the foregoing, on major construction projects located within the free zone, around the cities of Edmonton and Calgary, but beyond the city bus transportation system of those cities, where it is expected that the total construction workforce will exceed 500, the  affected  parties  shall  meet  to  discuss  the  viability  of  implementing  a  system  of providing transportation to the site.
summary: For major construction projects (over 500 workers) inside the free zone but outside city bus routes, relevant parties must meet to discuss providing transportation to the site.
logical_representation: IF job_location_radius_km (Unsupported) <= 45 AND is_beyond_city_bus_system (llm) == true AND total_workforce (llm) > 500 -> OBLIGATION('parties_meet_to_discuss_transportation')
reasoning: This rule outlines an obligation related to providing transportation, a benefit often associated with remote or difficult-to-access work locations, which is conceptually linked to subsistence.

name: Camp Bus Transit Time Allowance
rule_text: Workers shall be paid an allowance for time regularly and routinely in excess of forty five minutes each way, for travel within the applicable free zone.  The allowance shall be calculated on the regular straight time base rate of each worker.  The allowance will be paid only to workers who ride on the provided buses, and only for the days on which they ride the buses.
summary: Employees who ride provided buses to a site within the free zone shall be paid an allowance at their straight-time rate for any travel time that exceeds 45 minutes each way.
logical_representation: IF travel_mode (llm) == 'PROVIDED_BUS' AND travel_time_each_way_minutes (llm) > 45 -> PAY((travel_time_each_way_minutes (llm) - 45) * 2 / 60) AT ST_RATE
reasoning: This rule specifies that time spent traveling under certain conditions is paid, making it a rule about how time is categorized and compensated, which is the definition of LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Daily Travel Entitlements Beyond Free Zone
